result.execSummary:
The defendant Lynn M. Bayer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Associated with Charge #1

3:26 p.m. Defendant Lynn M. Bayer in court, in custody, with attorney Breanna Magallones. Jillian Pfeifer, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court speaks to history of the case. Counsel in receipt of revocation summary. Pfeifer/Magallones/Bayer statement to sentencing. Court statement. 3:44 p.m. adj.

Court sentence
Ct. 1 - concurrent to Shawano Co. case
9 months' county jail w/Huber - may serve in Shawano Co.
90 days' credit
Costs reverted to civil judgment

Ct. 2 - concurrent to Ct. 1
9 months' county jail w/Huber - may serve in Shawano Co.
90 days' credit
Costs reverted to civil judgment
Appeal rights given

2:11 p.m. Not on record. Defendant Lynn M. Bayer in court, in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant that Attorney Magallones has been appointed. Case will be called later this afternoon. Attorney Magallones will meet with Defendant to discuss revocation and will advise Court when ready to proceed.
for transport
from defendant to Judge
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
includes revocation summary and cover letter
Per PD's office Ms. Bayer has not contacted them for representation.  Copy of revocation packet and notice of hearing sent to Ms. Bayer at the Shawano Co Jail.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 26, 2017 at 09:00 am.

10:52 a.m. Defendant Lynn M. Bayer in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf191, 15tr2052, 15tr2048, 15tr2051, 15tr2049, 15tr2050. State moves to dismiss 15tr2050, 15tr2049, 15tr2051 and 15tr2052 - Granted. In 15cf191 - State moves to amend Count 1 to Misdemeanor Fleeing - violation of 346.04(2t) - Granted. Plea questionaire filed - Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Katte/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
In 15cf191
WHS/POP - 2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision fees
DNA Sample 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
AODA assessment and recovery
Cooperate and comply with health care/mental health providers
Sign any releases necessary for PO to check with health care/mental health compliance
Jail credit - 7 days
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given

In 15tr2048
Fine - $1000 (includes costs)
Blood draw - $35
Driver's License revocation - 8 months
Drivers' Safety Plan (may satisfy requirements in 15cf191)
AODA Assessment (may satisfy requirements in 15cf191)

Adj. 11:09 a.m.

3:49 p.m. Defendant Lynn M. Bayer in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf191, 15tr2048, 15tr2050, 15tr2049, 15tr2051, 15tr2052. Katte states there is a resolution in this case however there is an OWI - 1st with enhancer of minor child pending in Waupaca county that Defendant would like to have resolved prior to this case. Bail continued. Adj. 3:54 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.

15tr2049-2052 tracking along for status-
Writen waiver filed-   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.
Bail continued  Arraignment scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
No intoxicants, no taverns, no controlled substances or prescription drugs unless prescribed by physician and only in prescribed dosages and manner.

8:24 a.m. Defendant Lynn M. Bayer in custody, appears via video, with attorney Anne M. Katte. Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 15TR2048, 15TR2049, 15TR2050, 15TR2051. Attorney Katte appointed yesterday afternoon, has not had time to meet with defendant. Katte and defendant in receipt of complaint. Bayer speaks to bond; questioned by the Court. Michlig statement to bond; requests mother sign as surety. Court statement--amends bond to $2,500 signature bond with same conditions. Katte/defendant waive times limits for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
No intoxicants, no taverns, no controlled substances or prescription drugs unless prescribed by physician and only in prescribed dosages and manner.

1:20 p.m. Defendant Lynn M. Bayer in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Calling 15tr2048 - 15tr2051.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel.  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:15 am. Adj. 1:28 p.m.
